name: Basic Concepts - Core ICT Elements
description: Introduction to order blocks, fair value gaps, and liquidity concepts

rules.title: Order Block Definition
rules.rule_text: An order block is the last opposing candle before a strong directional move. Bullish order blocks are the last down-closing candle before upward displacement.
validation_questions: How do you identify a bullish order block?
examples: Bullish OB: Last red candle before 50+ pip upward move
Bearish OB: Last green candle before 50+ pip downward move

rules.title: Fair Value Gap Identification
rules.rule_text: A fair value gap is a three-candle pattern where the first candle's high/low doesn't overlap with the third candle's low/high, creating an imbalance.
validation_questions: How many candles form a fair value gap?
How do you measure a valid FVG?
examples: Bullish FVG: Gap between candle 1 high and candle 3 low
Bearish FVG: Gap between candle 1 low and candle 3 high

rules.title: Liquidity Identification
rules.rule_text: Liquidity rests above old highs (buy stops) and below old lows (sell stops). Equal highs and lows create strong liquidity pools.
examples: Double top = buy stops above equal highs
Double bottom = sell stops below equal lows

learning_objectives: Recognize fair value gaps and imbalances
Locate liquidity pools and stop levels
